**Simon Phillip Cowell** ([/ˈkaʊəl/](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/English "Help:IPA/English"); born 7 October 1959) is an English television personality, entrepreneur, and record executive. He has judged on the British television talent competition series *[Pop Idol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pop_Idol "Pop Idol")* (2001–2003), *[The X Factor UK](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_X_Factor_(British_TV_series) "The X Factor (British TV series)")* (2004–2010, 2014–2018) and *[Britain's Got Talent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Britain%27s_Got_Talent "Britain's Got Talent")* (2007–present), and the American television talent competition series *[American Idol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Idol "American Idol")* (2002–2010), *[The X Factor US](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_X_Factor_(American_TV_series) "The X Factor (American TV series)")* (2011–2013), and *[America's Got Talent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/America%27s_Got_Talent "America's Got Talent")* (2016–present). Cowell is the founder and sole owner of the British entertainment company [Syco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syco "Syco").

After some success in the 1980s and 1990s as a record producer, talent scout and consultant in the UK music industry, Cowell came to public prominence in 2001 as a judge on *Pop Idol*, a show which he and its creator [Simon Fuller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Fuller "Simon Fuller") successfully pitched to [ITV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ITV_(TV_network) "ITV (TV network)") Controller of Entertainment [Claudia Rosencrantz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claudia_Rosencrantz "Claudia Rosencrantz"). He subsequently created *[The X Factor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_X_Factor "The X Factor")* and *[Got Talent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Got_Talent "Got Talent")* franchises which have been sold around the world. In 2004 and 2010, *[Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_magazine "Time magazine")* named Cowell one of the [100 most influential people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_100 "Time 100") in the world.[\[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Cowell#cite_note-Time100-2004-2)[\[3]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Cowell#cite_note-Time100-2010-3) In 2008, *[The Daily Telegraph](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Daily_Telegraph "The Daily Telegraph")* ranked him sixth in their list of the "100 most powerful people in British culture".[\[4]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Cowell#cite_note-4) The same year, he received the Special Recognition Award at the [National Television Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_National_Television_Awards "14th National Television Awards").[\[5]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Cowell#cite_note-2008_NTA-5) At the [2010 British Academy Television Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Academy_Television_Awards_2010 "British Academy Television Awards 2010"), Cowell received the [BAFTA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BAFTA "BAFTA") Special Award for his "outstanding contribution to the entertainment industry and for his development of new talent".[\[6]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Cowell#cite_note-6) In 2018, he received a star on the [Hollywood Walk of Fame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame "Hollywood Walk of Fame") in the television category.[\[7]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Cowell#cite_note-7)
